name: ThreatStream
description: Integrates a variety of generic, reputation, and investigative actions from the Anomali ThreatStream threat intelligence platform

organization_id.description: Organization ID for filtering incidents when polling
organization_id.verbose: Organization ID is mandatory while polling and is used for filtering the incidents to ingest.

first_run_containers.description: Maximum number of incidents to poll in the first run of the scheduled polling

ingest_only_published_incidents.description: Ingest only incidents marked as published

is_cloud_instance.description: Is the provided instance in hostname parameter cloud?

actions.description: Test connectivity to ThreatStream by querying the intelligence endpoint
Get information about a file
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this is because ThreatStream has no information on that file. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

extend_source.description: Fetch extra data from Anomali server if available

actions.description: Get information about a given domain
actions.verbose:
If nothing is found, this may be due to the format of the domain. Try excluding any subdomains (namely www). If there is still no information found, then it is because ThreatStream has no information on that domain. ThreatStream, however, may still have Passive DNS (PDNS) information on it, which can be found in extra data. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.
Extra data includes PDNS, insights, and external resources. By default, extra data is not included in the response. You can update the flag params to include the extra data.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

extend_source.description: Fetch extra data from Anomali server if available

pdns.description: If enabled, pdns will also be fetched

insights.description: If enabled, insights will also be fetched

external_references.description: If enabled, external references will also be fetched

actions.description: Get information about a given IP
actions.verbose:
If nothing is found, then it is because ThreatStream has no information on that IP. ThreatStream, however, may still have Passive DNS (PDNS) information on it, which can be found in extra data. If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.
Extra data includes PDNS, insights, and external resources. By default, extra data is not included in the response. You can update the flag params to include the extra data.

limit.description: Total number of observables to return

extend_source.description: Fetch extra data from Anomali server if available

pdns.description: If enabled, pdns will also be fetched

insights.description: If enabled, insights will also be fetched

external_references.description: If enabled, external references will also be fetched

actions.verbose: ThreatStream returns whois info as a raw string (present in the raw field) which the app will then attempt to parse into the output. Depending on the contents of the raw string, it may not be able to parse all or any of the required fields.

actions.description: Import domain observable into ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• For importing domain observables without approval, the user must provide indicator type in the field parameter (e.g - "mal_domain") whereas, for importing observables with approval, the user must provide threat type in the field parameter (e.g - "malware").
  • The possible values of indicator type (itype) and threat_type are listed at the starting of the documentation. If the input contains any indicator type (itype) or threat_type value except the ones listed, the action will behave according to the API behavior.

source.description: Source of observable to import (It will only be reflected on UI when observable is imported without approval)

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to associate with this Observable

create_on_cloud.description: Create on remote (cloud)? (applicable only for hybrid on-prem instances)

allow_unresolved.description: Unresolved domains will be imported if set to true

example_values: Successfully sent the request for importing the observable

  • The possible values of indicator type (itype) and threat_type are listed at the starting of the documentation. If the input contains any indicator type (itype) or threat_type value except the ones listed, the action will behave according to the API behavior.

allow_unresolved.description: Unresolved urls will be imported if set to true

actions.description: Import observables into ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• For importing observables without approval, the user must provide indicator type in the field parameter (e.g - {"itype": "<indicator_type>"}) whereas, for importing observables with approval, the user must provide threat type in the field parameter (e.g - {"threat_type": "<threat_type>"}).
  • The "allow_unresolved" parameter will be passed in the API call if the "value" parameter is set to "domain" or "url" and "with_approval" parameter is set to "False".
  • The possible values of indicator type (itype) and threat_type are listed at the starting of the documentation. If the input contains any indicator type (itype) or threat_type value except the ones listed, the action will behave according to the API behavior.
  • For importing observables of type 'URL', 'IP' and 'Domain', Threatstream itself detects the confidence value whereas, for importing observables of type 'Email', 'File', the user must provide confidence value in the field parameter (e.g - {"itype": "<indicator_type>", "confidence": <confidence_value>}).
  • If both the "itype" and "threat_type" values are passed in the "fields" parameter when "with_approval" is set to "True", the action will behave according to the API behavior.

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to include with the observable

create_on_cloud.description: Create on remote (cloud)? (applicable only for hybrid on-prem instances)

allow_unresolved.description: Unresolved domains will be imported if set to true

example_values: Successfully sent the request for importing the observable

actions.description: Detonate file in ThreatStream
actions.verbose: If classification or platform parameter is added and is also mentioned in the fields parameter, the value given in the individual parameters is considered.

platform.description: Which platform to run the detonation on - Ex: WINDOWS10x64. Default is 'WINDOWS7' which will run the detonation on 'WINDOWS7' platform

vault_id.description: Vault id of file to be detonated

classification.description: Classification of the sandbox submission - private or public

use_premium_sandbox.description: Specify whether the premium sandbox should be used for detonation - true or false. If you want to use the Joe Sandbox service for detonation, set this attribute to true

use_vmray_sandbox.description: Specify whether the vmray sandbox should be used for detonation - true or false. If you want to use the VMRay sandbox service for detonation, set this attribute to true

vmray_max_jobs.description: Specify the number of detonations you want VMRay to perform for the submission

fields.description: JSON formatted string of additional fields to be included in the detonate file action. e.g. {"file_has_password":"true","file_password":"abc123"}. Please check the API doc to find more information on other valid fields

actions.description: Detonate URL in ThreatStream
actions.verbose: If classification or platform parameter is added and is also mentioned in the fields parameter, the value given in the individual parameters is considered.

platform.description: Which platform to run the detonation on - Ex: WINDOWS10x64. Default is 'WINDOWS7' which will run the detonation on 'WINDOWS7' platform

classification.description: Classification of the sandbox submission - private or public

use_premium_sandbox.description: Specify whether the premium sandbox should be used for detonation - true or false. If you want to use the Joe Sandbox service for detonation, set this attribute to true

use_vmray_sandbox.description: Specify whether the vmray sandbox should be used for detonation - true or false. If you want to use the VMRay sandbox service for detonation, set this attribute to true

vmray_max_jobs.description: Specify the number of detonations you want VMRay to perform for the submission

fields.description: JSON formatted string of additional fields to be included in the detonate url action. e.g. {"import_indicators":"true","report_radio-notes":"Credential-Exposure,compromised_email"}. Please check the API doc to find more infomation on other valid fields

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records (incidents) to query for

actions.description: Run observables query in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
For providing the query parameter, please form a valid search string using the Anomali filter language (as seen on the advanced search page) and then convert it into a valid JSON string as shown in the example here. e.g. Anomali filter language-based search string = modifed_ts__gt=2018-01-10&status=active has to be provided in the query parameter as { "modifed_ts__gt": "2018-01-10", "status": "active" }
If offset is provided in the 'query' parameter, it will be overwritten by the offset value provided in the 'offset' parameter.

query.description: Search string in JSON format using the Anomali filter language (as seen on the advanced search page)

order_by.description: Field by which the query results will be ordered

offset.description: Record offset (used with paging, when returning many results)

example_values: DomainsByProxy.com|14455 N. Hayden Road, Scottsdale, Arizona, UNITED STATES, 85260
imported by user 13487 Confirmed as false positive

actions.description: List all the import sessions
actions.verbose:
• For a Hybrid instance, this action will return both remote and local data based on the input parameters.
  • The user can use the list imports action to fetch only remote or local data in the response.

date_modified_gte.description: Import sessions with greater than or equal to the provided modified date will be returned

limit.description: Total number of import sessions to return

offset.description: Record offset (used with paging, when returning many results)

actions.description: This action updates the fields of the provided item id
actions.verbose: If "null" is provided in the expire time parameter, then expiration time will be set to "9999-12-31T00:00:00".

item_id.description: ID of the import session to update

tlp.description: Traffic Light Protocol value to update

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to update

expire_time.description: Expiration time to update (Format : YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:ss[.uuuuuu]][TZ])

threat_model_type.description: Comma-separated list of threat model types to associate

threat_model_to_associate.description: Comma-separated list of threat model IDs to associate

actions.description: List all the threat models

modified_ts__gte.description: Threat models with greater than or equal to the provided modified time stamp will be returned

limit.description: Total number of threat models to return

model_type.description: Model type to filter the records

tags_name.description: Tag name to filter the records

publication_status.description: Publication status to filter the records

actions.description: Create a threat bulletin in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• Circles parameter will only be applicable when a threat bulletin will be created on the cloud.
  • If the body_content_type parameter is not provided, then the default value (markdown) will be considered as the value of the body_content_type parameter. Once created, body_content_type cannot be modified.

name.description: Name to give the threat bulletin

status.description: Status to give the threat bulletin

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags for the threat bulletin

tlp.description: Tlp to give the threat bulletin

assignee_user_id.description: Assignee to give the threat bulletin

body.description: Body content to give the threat bulletin

body_content_type.description: Body content type to give the threat bulletin (Once specified, body_content_type cannot be modified, Default is 'markdown')

comments.description: Comments to give the threat bulletin(JSON format containing body, title, etc.)

attachments.description: Vault id of an attachment to add on the threat bulletin

local_intelligence.description: Comma-separated list of local intelligence IDs to associate with the threat bulletin - Note that this appends

cloud_intelligence.description: Comma-separated list of remote intelligence IDs to associate with the threat bulletin - Note that this appends

circles.description: Comma-separated list of circles to give the threat bulletin (Applicable only when a cloud threat bulletin will be created)

import_sessions.description: Comma-separated list of sessions to give the threat bulletin

create_on_cloud.description: Create on remote (cloud)? (applicable only for hybrid on-prem instances)

is_anonymous.description: Whether the threat bulletin user and organization information is anonymized

example_values: Threat bulletin created successfully. Associated intelligence : 229717582, 229717444, 1000000298, 1000000001

actions.description: Update a threat bulletin in ThreatStream
actions.verbose: Circles parameter will only be applicable when a cloud threat bulletin will be updated.

status.description: Status to give the threat bulletin

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags for the threat bulletin

tlp.description: Tlp to give the threat bulletin

assignee_user_id.description: Assignee to give the threat bulletin

body.description: Body content to give the threat bulletin

comments.description: Comments to give the threat bulletin(JSON format containing body, title, etc.)

local_intelligence.description: Comma-separated list of local intelligence IDs to associate with the threat bulletin - Note that this appends

cloud_intelligence.description: Comma-separated list of remote intelligence IDs to associate with the threat bulletin - Note that this appends

attachments.description: Vault id of an attachment to add on the threat bulletin

circles.description: Comma-separated list of circles to give the threat bulletin (Applicable only when a cloud threat bulletin will be updated)

import_sessions.description: Comma-separated list of sessions to give the threat bulletin

is_anonymous.description: Whether the threat bulletin user and organization information is anonymized

example_values: Successfully updated threat bulletin. Associated intelligence : 1000000298, 1000000001, 229717582, 229717444

actions.description: List threat bulletins present in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• This action will list the threat bulletins in oldest first format.
  • is_public parameter will only be applicable as filter when its value will be set to "true" or "false". It wont be applied as a filter and will list all the threat bulletins when the value of is_public parameter is set to "all".

limit.description: Total number of threat bulletins to return

name.description: Name to filter the threat bulletins

status.description: Status to filter the threat bulletins

source.description: Source to filter the threat bulletins

assignee_user_id.description: Assignee to filter the threat bulletins

actions.description: List associations of an entity present in ThreatStream

limit.description: Total number of associations to return

entity_type.description: Type of threat model entity to list the associations

associated_entity_type.description: Type of associations of the enitity to list

actions.description: Creates a new rule in Threatstream
actions.verbose:
• In the field param, tags, actors, malware, campaigns, incidents, signature, tips, ttps, vulnerabilities accepts list of IDs as an example: {“incidents”: [1000000001], “actors”: [1000000001], “vulnerabilities”: [1000000001, 1000000002], “campaigns”: [1000000001], “signatures”: [1000000001], “tags”: [{“name”:“test_tag”,“tlp”:“white”}], “match_impacts”: [ “actor_ip”, “actor_ipv6” ]}
  • In field param, at least one Match Within parameter (match_observables, match_reportedfiles, match_signatures, match_tips, or match_vulnerabilities) should be true. Otherwise, the action will pass and a rule will be created but it will throw an error while updating it from the UI.
  • Do not specify values for both match_impacts and exclude_impacts in the same request. Indicator types specified in match_impacts are filtered out if also specified in exclude_impacts.

keywords.description: List of keywords for which you want the rule to match. i.e ["keyword1", "keyword2"]

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to include with the rule

create_on_cloud.description: Create on remote (cloud)? (applicable only for hybrid on-prem instances)

example_values: testing for common action create campaign on prem

actions.description: Update a rule in ThreatStream by ID number

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to update on the incident

rule_id.description: ID number of rule to update

example_values: {   "actors": [        ],   "vulnerabilities": [        ],   "match_observables": True,   "match_reportedfiles": False,   "match_signatures": True,   "match_tips": True,   "match_vulnerabilities": True,   "tags": [     "test",     "tag1"   ],   "create_investigation": True,   "match_impacts": [     "actor_ip",     "actor_ipv6"   ],   "exclude_notify_org_whitelisted": True,   "exclude_notify_owner_org": True , "incidents": [1000000184], "ttps": [119]}
testing for common action create campaign on prem

actions.description: List rules present in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• The rules will be listed in the latest first order on the basis of created_ts.
  • If the limit parameter is not provided, then the default value (1000) will be considered as the value of the limit parameter.

limit.description: Total number of rules to return

actions.description: Delete rule in ThreatStream by ID number

rule_id.description: ID number of rule to delete

actions.description: Create associations between threat model entities on the ThreatStream platform

entity_type.description: The type of the threat model entity on which want to add the association

entity_id.description: The ID of the threat model entity on which want to add the association

associated_entity_type.description: The type of threat model entity which will associate the initial entity

local_ids.description: Comma-separated list of local entity IDs to associate with the entity (this will appends on the existing)

remote_ids.description: Comma-separated list of remote enitity IDs to associate with the entity (this will appends on the existing)

example_values: Successfully updated associations. Modified entities : 10909. Please check for the non-modified ids as they would be already associated or invalid

actions.description: Remove associations between threat model entities on the ThreatStream platform

entity_id.description: ID of the threat model entity from which you are removing the association

associated_entity_type.description: Type of threat model entity with which you are associating the initial entity

local_ids.description: Comma-separated list of local enitity IDs to associate with the entity - Note that this appends

remote_ids.description: Comma-separated list of remote enitity IDs to associate with the entity - Note that this appends

example_values: Successfully updated associations. Modified entities : 10909. Please check for the non-modified ids as they would be already associated or invalid

actions.description: Update an observable in ThreatStream
actions.verbose: If any of the indicator_type, confidence, tlp, severity, status, or expiration_date parameter is added and is also mentioned in the fields parameter, the value given in the individual parameters is considered.

indicator_type.description: Indicator type to give the observable

status.description: Status to give the observable (For example, active, inactive, falsepos)

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp to give the observable (in UTC format)

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to include with the observable
